p: The characteristics of these regimes vary with β. Figure 4 shows the final reach of the epidemic and the cumulative rewiring for different values of β. For the evangelizers case, the epidemic always spreads to the entire population. For the cool kids case, the reach of the epidemic increases gradually with β, since faster spreading increases how many individuals get infected before the susceptible become disconnected. For the snobs case, larger β increases the reach of the epidemic, with a rapid transition from minimal spread to full spread once β passes a critical threshold. In all these cases, the total amount of rewiring decreases when β is sufficiently large, since rewiring stops once the epidemic has swept through the population. Interestingly, the amount of rewirings for the snobs case also decreases with lower β, peaking around the critical threshold. This occurs because when transmission is slow, equilibrium is reached very quickly: assortative rewiring by the infected and the susceptible quickly disconnects these two groups before the infection can spread.
